Sentence_location: In this study, we combine cultivation and HIS techniques to survey actinobacteria and cyanobacteria diversity along different soll and endolithic micro-environments of Victoria Valley in McMurdo Dry Valleys.

Sentence_location: Our results demonstrate that the Dry Valleys actinobacteria and cyanobacteria distribution is driven by environmental forces, in particular the effect of water availability and endolithic environments clearly conditioned the distribution of those communities.

Sentence_location: Oligotrophic soils from the Dry Valleys are considered to be microbiologically distinct from all other soils worldwide

Sentence_species: ANT.L52B.3 AR4-GA-1C Leptolyngbya MH742928 Leptolyngbya
Sentence_location: In addition to soil environments, rocky niches are of particular relevance in the Dry Valleys ecosystems since they provide protection to different biota from harsh environmental conditions such as intense solar radiation exposure, temperature fluctuations, wind, and desiccation (Cockell and Stokes, 2004; Walker and Pace, 2007).

Sentence_species: ANT.L52B.3 AR4-GA-1C Leptolyngbya MH742928 Leptolyngbya
Sentence_location: These rock-inhabiting organisms are very important in Dry Valleys because of the extent of rockexposed surface, thus accounting largely for the productivity and biomass in this system (Omelon, 2008;

Sentence_location: Dry Valleys

Sentence_species: ANT.L52B.3 AR4-GA-1C Leptolyngbya MH742928 Leptolyngbya
Sentence_location:
Indeed, as primary colonizers after the retreat of glaciers, cyanobacteria are leading components of Dry Valleys ecosystem, enabling colonization by
other microorganisms (Vincent, 2000).

Sentence_species: ANT.L52B.3 AR4-GA-1C Leptolyngbya MH742928 Leptolyngbya
Sentence_location: They are well adapted to the stress of desiccation and despite most of the Dry Valleys soils lack any visible cyanobacterial growth, their presence was detected through HTS even in low moisture soil samples (Wood et al., 2008).

Sentence_species: ANT.L52B.3 AR4-GA-1C Leptolyngbya MH742928 Leptolyngbya
Sentence_location: Cultivation-independent studies have revealed that in the Dry Valleys, abiotic factors drive the diversity and structure of microbial communities (Pointing et al., 2009; Lee et al., 2012; Magalhaes et al., 2012).

Sentence_species: ANT.L52B.3 AR4-GA-1C Leptolyngbya MH742928 Leptolyngbya
Sentence_location: Aridity seem to be the most preponderant factor shaping bacterial communites, not only in Dry Valleys but across multiple deserts (Kastovska et al., 2005; Pointing et al., 2007; Wood et al., 2008).

Sentence_species: ANT.L52B.3 AR4-GA-1C Leptolyngbya MH742928 Leptolyngbya
Sentence_location: In the present study, we combine HTS and microbial cultivation techniques as culture-independent and dependent approaches to survey actinobacteria and cyanobacteria diversity along different soil and endolithic micro-environments of Victoria Valley, one of the Dry Valleys.

Sentence_location: Members of Euzebyaceae were detected particularly in END and T3 sample (Figure 3C), which is corroborated by previous works that have found the presence of members of the Euzebya genus in Dry Valleys hypolithic and endolithic communities (Van Goethem et al., 2016).

Sentence_location: In Atacama desert, their presence was also detected in endolithic microhabitats (Meslier et al., 2018).

Sentence_location: According to the literature, Euzebya seems to be highly adapted to endolithic and hypolithic environments, however, our study seems to be the first that detected the presence of this genus in the Dry Valleys soils.

Sentence_species: Leptolyngbya MH742929 Leptolyngbya frigida 1 AY49361 2.1 98

10.3389/fmicb.2019.01018
Bacterial diversity from McMurdo Dry Valleys in Antarctica, the coldest desert on earth, has become more easily assessed with the development of High Throughput Sequencing (HTS) techniques.

Sentence_species: Leptolyngbya MH742929 Leptolyngbya frigida 1 AY49361 2.1 98
Sentence_location: In this study, we combine cultivation and HIS techniques to survey actinobacteria and cyanobacteria diversity along different soll and endolithic micro-environments of Victoria Valley in McMurdo Dry Valleys.

Sentence_species: Leptolyngbya MH742929 Leptolyngbya frigida 1 AY49361 2.1 98
Sentence_location: Our results demonstrate that the Dry Valleys actinobacteria and cyanobacteria distribution is driven by environmental forces, in particular the effect of water availability and endolithic environments clearly conditioned the distribution of those communities.

Sentence_species: Leptolyngbya MH742929 Leptolyngbya frigida 1 AY49361 2.1 98
Sentence_location:
Keywords: actinobacteria, McMurdo Dry Valleys, Antarctic soil, bacteria diversity, bacterial cultivability, endolitic microbiota, Antarctic microenvironments, cyanobacteria

Sentence_species: Leptolyngbya MH742929 Leptolyngbya frigida 1 AY49361 2.1 98
Sentence_location: The continent of Antarctica comprises about 0.34% ice-free areas (

Sentence_species: Leptolyngbya MH742929 Leptolyngbya frigida 1 AY49361 2.1 98
Sentence_location: In the McMurdo Dry Valleys (henceforth Dry Valleys), the largest ice-free region of the Antarctic continent

Sentence_species: Leptolyngbya MH742929 Leptolyngbya frigida 1 AY49361 2.1 98
Sentence_location: In the McMurdo Dry Valleys (henceforth Dry Valleys), the largest ice-free region of the Antarctic continent

Sentence_species: Leptolyngbya MH742929 Leptolyngbya frigida 1 AY49361 2.1 98
Sentence_location: Oligotrophic soils from the Dry Valleys are considered to be microbiologically distinct from all other soils worldwide

Sentence_species: Leptolyngbya MH742929 Leptolyngbya frigida 1 AY49361 2.1 98
Sentence_location: In addition to soil environments, rocky niches are of particular relevance in the Dry Valleys ecosystems since they provide protection to different biota from harsh environmental conditions such as intense solar radiation exposure, temperature fluctuations, wind, and desiccation (Cockell and Stokes, 2004; Walker and Pace, 2007).

Sentence_species: Leptolyngbya MH742929 Leptolyngbya frigida 1 AY49361 2.1 98
Sentence_location: These rock-inhabiting organisms are very important in Dry Valleys because of the extent of rockexposed surface, thus accounting largely for the productivity and biomass in this system (Omelon, 2008;

Sentence_species: Leptolyngbya MH742929 Leptolyngbya frigida 1 AY49361 2.1 98
Sentence_location: Dry Valleys

Sentence_species: Leptolyngbya MH742929 Leptolyngbya frigida 1 AY49361 2.1 98
Sentence_location:
Indeed, as primary colonizers after the retreat of glaciers, cyanobacteria are leading components of Dry Valleys ecosystem, enabling colonization by
other microorganisms (Vincent, 2000).

Sentence_species: Leptolyngbya MH742929 Leptolyngbya frigida 1 AY49361 2.1 98
Sentence_location: They are well adapted to the stress of desiccation and despite most of the Dry Valleys soils lack any visible cyanobacterial growth, their presence was detected through HTS even in low moisture soil samples (Wood et al., 2008).

Sentence_species: Leptolyngbya MH742929 Leptolyngbya frigida 1 AY49361 2.1 98
Sentence_location: Cultivation-independent studies have revealed that in the Dry Valleys, abiotic factors drive the diversity and structure of microbial communities (Pointing et al., 2009; Lee et al., 2012; Magalhaes et al., 2012).

Sentence_species: Leptolyngbya MH742929 Leptolyngbya frigida 1 AY49361 2.1 98
Sentence_location: Aridity seem to be the most preponderant factor shaping bacterial communites, not only in Dry Valleys but across multiple deserts (Kastovska et al., 2005; Pointing et al., 2007; Wood et al., 2008).

Sentence_species: Leptolyngbya MH742929 Leptolyngbya frigida 1 AY49361 2.1 98
Sentence_location: In the present study, we combine HTS and microbial cultivation techniques as culture-independent and dependent approaches to survey actinobacteria and cyanobacteria diversity along different soil and endolithic micro-environments of Victoria Valley, one of the Dry Valleys.

Sentence_species: Leptolyngbya MH742929 Leptolyngbya frigida 1 AY49361 2.1 98
Sentence_location: | Variation of soil characteristics across the Dry Valley soil transect, including water availability

Sentence_species: Leptolyngbya MH742929 Leptolyngbya frigida 1 AY49361 2.1 98
Sentence_location: The dilutions were plated onto an oligotrophic medium - Nutrient-poor sediment extract (NPS) - primarily made with an extract from the original Antarctica soil sample and then with sand collected from a beach in northern Portugal

Sentence_species: Leptolyngbya MH742929 Leptolyngbya frigida 1 AY49361 2.1 98
Sentence_location: The hyper-arid desert of McMurdo Dry Valleys, located in Victoria Land is considered one of the most inhospitable habitats, being restricted to microbial colonization (Pointing et al., 2009).

Sentence_species: Leptolyngbya MH742929 Leptolyngbya frigida 1 AY49361 2.1 98
Sentence_location: Actinobacteria, Acidobacteria, and Bacteroidetes are usually the dominant phyla described for Dry Valleys (Aislabie et al., 2006; Cary et al., 2010).

Sentence_species: Leptolyngbya MH742929 Leptolyngbya frigida 1 AY49361 2.1 98
Sentence_location: The Rubrobacter genus, commonly found in Dry Valleys (Wei et al., 2016) has been reported as dominant genus of endolithic microbial communities in Atacama Desert

Sentence_species: Leptolyngbya MH742929 Leptolyngbya frigida 1 AY49361 2.1 98
Sentence_location: The Rubrobacter genus, commonly found in Dry Valleys (Wei et al., 2016) has been reported as dominant genus of endolithic microbial communities in Atacama Desert

Sentence_species: Leptolyngbya MH742929 Leptolyngbya frigida 1 AY49361 2.1 98
Sentence_location: (2013) in Arctic desert soils.

Sentence_species: Leptolyngbya MH742929 Leptolyngbya frigida 1 AY49361 2.1 98
Sentence_location: Previous studies have detected Rubrobacter in Dry Valleys soils (Aislabie et al., 2013; Wei et al., 2016), and the observed distribution suggests that this genus might be widely adapted to this environment.

Sentence_species: Leptolyngbya MH742929 Leptolyngbya frigida 1 AY49361 2.1 98
Sentence_location: Members of Sporichthyaceae family, with a higher distribution in sample T5, have been reported from Dry Valleys soil (Van Goethem et al., 2016) and cryptoendolithic communities (de la Torre et al., 2003) as well as Atacama desert soils (Idris et al., 2017).

Sentence_species: Leptolyngbya MH742929 Leptolyngbya frigida 1 AY49361 2.1 98
Sentence_location: Members of Euzebyaceae were detected particularly in END and T3 sample (Figure 3C), which is corroborated by previous works that have found the presence of members of the Euzebya genus in Dry Valleys hypolithic and endolithic communities (Van Goethem et al., 2016).

Sentence_species: Leptolyngbya MH742929 Leptolyngbya frigida 1 AY49361 2.1 98
Sentence_location: In Atacama desert, their presence was also detected in endolithic microhabitats (Meslier et al., 2018).

Sentence_species: Leptolyngbya MH742929 Leptolyngbya frigida 1 AY49361 2.1 98
Sentence_location: According to the literature, Euzebya seems to be highly adapted to endolithic and hypolithic environments, however, our study seems to be the first that detected the presence of this genus in the Dry Valleys soils.

Sentence_species: Leptolyngbya MH742929 Leptolyngbya frigida 1 AY49361 2.1 98
Sentence_location:
Remarkably, the endolithic sample was the only among those studied to harbor actinobacteria affiliated with Streptomycetaceae, a family commonly found and retrieved by
cultivation from Dry Valleys soils samples (Cameron et al., 1972; Babalola et al., 2009).

Sentence_species: Leptolyngbya MH742929 Leptolyngbya frigida 1 AY49361 2.1 98

Culture-based studies on Dry Valleys have initially proposed a dominance of a small number of aerobic groups, and
few anaerobic isolates for endolithic

Sentence_species: Leptolyngbya MH742929 Leptolyngbya frigida 1 AY49361 2.1 98
Sentence_location: However, molecular-based phylogenetic studies have revealed microbial diversity of Antarctic Dry Valley as remarkably high (Smith et al., 2006).

Sentence_species: Leptolyngbya MH742929 Leptolyngbya frigida 1 AY49361 2.1 98
Sentence_location: At least 14 different bacterial phyla have been described from Dry Valleys bacterial lithic communities dominated by Acidobacteria, Actinobacteria and Bacteroidetes (Cary et al., 2010).

Sentence_species: Leptolyngbya MH742929 Leptolyngbya frigida 1 AY49361 2.1 98
Sentence_location: For the Sporichthyaceae family, there are no records of cultivation isolates in Antarctica.

Sentence_species: Leptolyngbya MH742929 Leptolyngbya frigida 1 AY49361 2.1 98
Sentence_location: The Kocuria genus has resulted from the phylogenetic and chemotaxonomic division of Micrococcus genus and both include species isolated in Antarctica (Liu et al., 2000; Reddy et al., 2003).

Sentence_location: Pioneer studies on Dry Valleys cyanobacterial distribution, have proven that the majority of cryptoendolithic cyanobacteriadominated communities belong to the Phormidium genus (Friedmann, 1986).

Sentence_location: one Leptolyngbya antarctica strain previously isolated from a benthic microbial mat in Dry Valleys and eastern Antarctic lakes (Taton et al., 2006).

Sentence_location: Thus, our findings suggest that a taxonomic revision of the species L. antarctica (West and G.S.West)

Sentence_location: According to the phylogenetic tree, the unidentified Synechococcales strain is most closely related to uncultured cyanobacterium strains from Antarctica, and according to the matrix of distances it only shares 97.5% of similarity to Phormidesmis priestleyi ANT.LACV5.1, suggesting it can represent a new species.

Sentence_location: Notably, most of the closest relatives at NCBI correspond all to the same study (Taton et al. 2006) that assessed the cyanobacteria diversity in Antarctic lakes, including in the Dry Valleys.

Sentence_location: This study highlights the capacity of Dry Valleys prokaryotic communities to thrive below thresholds that are considered to be life-limiting.

The major role of actinobacteria and cyanobacteria, the dominant heterotrophs

Bacterial diversity from McMurdo Dry Valleys in Antarctica, the coldest desert on earth, has become more easily assessed with the development of High Throughput Sequencing (HTS) techniques.

Bacterial diversity from McMurdo Dry Valleys in Antarctica, the coldest desert on earth, has become more easily assessed with the development of High Throughput Sequencing (HTS) techniques.

Sentence_species: AY493588.1 Leptolyngbya antarctica ANT.LAC.1 e@
Sentence_location: In this study, we combine cultivation and HIS techniques to survey actinobacteria and cyanobacteria diversity along different soll and endolithic micro-environments of Victoria Valley in McMurdo Dry Valleys.

Sentence_species: AY493588.1 Leptolyngbya antarctica ANT.LAC.1 e@
Sentence_location: Our results demonstrate that the Dry Valleys actinobacteria and cyanobacteria distribution is driven by environmental forces, in particular the effect of water availability and endolithic environments clearly conditioned the distribution of those communities.

Sentence_species: AY493588.1 Leptolyngbya antarctica ANT.LAC.1 e@

INTRODUCTION

Sentence_species: AY493588.1 Leptolyngbya antarctica ANT.LAC.1 e@
Sentence_location: The continent of Antarctica comprises about 0.34% ice-free areas (

Sentence_species: AY493588.1 Leptolyngbya antarctica ANT.LAC.1 e@
Sentence_location: In the McMurdo Dry Valleys (henceforth Dry Valleys), the largest ice-free region of the Antarctic continent

Sentence_species: AY493588.1 Leptolyngbya antarctica ANT.LAC.1 e@
Sentence_location: In the McMurdo Dry Valleys (henceforth Dry Valleys), the largest ice-free region of the Antarctic continent

Sentence_species: AY493588.1 Leptolyngbya antarctica ANT.LAC.1 e@
Sentence_location: Oligotrophic soils from the Dry Valleys are considered to be microbiologically distinct from all other soils worldwide

Sentence_species: AY493588.1 Leptolyngbya antarctica ANT.LAC.1 e@
Sentence_location: In addition to soil environments, rocky niches are of particular relevance in the Dry Valleys ecosystems since they provide protection to different biota from harsh environmental conditions such as intense solar radiation exposure, temperature fluctuations, wind, and desiccation (Cockell and Stokes, 2004; Walker and Pace, 2007).

Sentence_species: AY493588.1 Leptolyngbya antarctica ANT.LAC.1 e@
Sentence_location: These rock-inhabiting organisms are very important in Dry Valleys because of the extent of rockexposed surface, thus accounting largely for the productivity and biomass in this system (Omelon, 2008;

Sentence_species: AY493588.1 Leptolyngbya antarctica ANT.LAC.1 e@
Sentence_location: Dry Valleys

Sentence_species: AY493588.1 Leptolyngbya antarctica ANT.LAC.1 e@
Sentence_location:
Indeed, as primary colonizers after the retreat of glaciers, cyanobacteria are leading components of Dry Valleys ecosystem, enabling colonization by
other microorganisms (Vincent, 2000).

Sentence_species: AY493588.1 Leptolyngbya antarctica ANT.LAC.1 e@
Sentence_location: They are well adapted to the stress of desiccation and despite most of the Dry Valleys soils lack any visible cyanobacterial growth, their presence was detected through HTS even in low moisture soil samples (Wood et al., 2008).

Sentence_species: AY493588.1 Leptolyngbya antarctica ANT.LAC.1 e@
Sentence_location: Cultivation-independent studies have revealed that in the Dry Valleys, abiotic factors drive the diversity and structure of microbial communities (Pointing et al., 2009; Lee et al., 2012; Magalhaes et al., 2012).

Sentence_species: AY493588.1 Leptolyngbya antarctica ANT.LAC.1 e@
Sentence_location: Aridity seem to be the most preponderant factor shaping bacterial communites, not only in Dry Valleys but across multiple deserts (Kastovska et al., 2005; Pointing et al., 2007; Wood et al., 2008).

Sentence_species: AY493588.1 Leptolyngbya antarctica ANT.LAC.1 e@
Sentence_location: In the present study, we combine HTS and microbial cultivation techniques as culture-independent and dependent approaches to survey actinobacteria and cyanobacteria diversity along different soil and endolithic micro-environments of Victoria Valley, one of the Dry Valleys.

Sentence_species: AY493588.1 Leptolyngbya antarctica ANT.LAC.1 e@
Sentence_location: | Variation of soil characteristics across the Dry Valley soil transect, including water availability

Sentence_species: AY493588.1 Leptolyngbya antarctica ANT.LAC.1 e@
Sentence_location: The dilutions were plated onto an oligotrophic medium - Nutrient-poor sediment extract (NPS) - primarily made with an extract from the original Antarctica soil sample and then with sand collected from a beach in northern Portugal

Sentence_species: AY493588.1 Leptolyngbya antarctica ANT.LAC.1 e@
Sentence_location: The hyper-arid desert of McMurdo Dry Valleys, located in Victoria Land is considered one of the most inhospitable habitats, being restricted to microbial colonization (Pointing et al., 2009).

Sentence_species: AY493588.1 Leptolyngbya antarctica ANT.LAC.1 e@
Sentence_location: Actinobacteria, Acidobacteria, and Bacteroidetes are usually the dominant phyla described for Dry Valleys (Aislabie et al., 2006; Cary et al., 2010).

Sentence_species: AY493588.1 Leptolyngbya antarctica ANT.LAC.1 e@
Sentence_location: The Rubrobacter genus, commonly found in Dry Valleys (Wei et al., 2016) has been reported as dominant genus of endolithic microbial communities in Atacama Desert

Sentence_species: AY493588.1 Leptolyngbya antarctica ANT.LAC.1 e@
Sentence_location: The Rubrobacter genus, commonly found in Dry Valleys (Wei et al., 2016) has been reported as dominant genus of endolithic microbial communities in Atacama Desert

Sentence_location: (2013) in Arctic desert soils.

Sentence_species: AY493588.1 Leptolyngbya antarctica ANT.LAC.1 e@
Sentence_location: Previous studies have detected Rubrobacter in Dry Valleys soils (Aislabie et al., 2013; Wei et al., 2016), and the observed distribution suggests that this genus might be widely adapted to this environment.

Sentence_species: AY493588.1 Leptolyngbya antarctica ANT.LAC.1 e@
Sentence_location: Members of Sporichthyaceae family, with a higher distribution in sample T5, have been reported from Dry Valleys soil (Van Goethem et al., 2016) and cryptoendolithic communities (de la Torre et al., 2003) as well as Atacama desert soils (Idris et al., 2017).

Sentence_species: AY493588.1 Leptolyngbya antarctica ANT.LAC.1 e@
Sentence_location: Members of Euzebyaceae were detected particularly in END and T3 sample (Figure 3C), which is corroborated by previous works that have found the presence of members of the Euzebya genus in Dry Valleys hypolithic and endolithic communities (Van Goethem et al., 2016).

Sentence_species: AY493588.1 Leptolyngbya antarctica ANT.LAC.1 e@
Sentence_location: In Atacama desert, their presence was also detected in endolithic microhabitats (Meslier et al., 2018).

Sentence_species: AY493588.1 Leptolyngbya antarctica ANT.LAC.1 e@
Sentence_location: According to the literature, Euzebya seems to be highly adapted to endolithic and hypolithic environments, however, our study seems to be the first that detected the presence of this genus in the Dry Valleys soils.

Sentence_species: AY493588.1 Leptolyngbya antarctica ANT.LAC.1 e@
Sentence_location:
Remarkably, the endolithic sample was the only among those studied to harbor actinobacteria affiliated with Streptomycetaceae, a family commonly found and retrieved by
cultivation from Dry Valleys soils samples (Cameron et al., 1972; Babalola et al., 2009).

10.3389/fmicb.2019.01018
Bacterial diversity from McMurdo Dry Valleys in Antarctica, the coldest desert on earth, has become more easily assessed with the development of High Throughput Sequencing (HTS) techniques.

Sentence_species: AY493576.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location:
10.3389/fmicb.2019.01018
Bacterial diversity from McMurdo Dry Valleys in Antarctica, the coldest desert on earth, has become more easily assessed with the development of High Throughput Sequencing (HTS) techniques.

Sentence_species: AY493576.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: In this study, we combine cultivation and HIS techniques to survey actinobacteria and cyanobacteria diversity along different soll and endolithic micro-environments of Victoria Valley in McMurdo Dry Valleys.

Sentence_species: AY493576.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: Our results demonstrate that the Dry Valleys actinobacteria and cyanobacteria distribution is driven by environmental forces, in particular the effect of water availability and endolithic environments clearly conditioned the distribution of those communities.

Sentence_species: AY493576.1 Leptolyngbya frigida

Sentence_location: In the McMurdo Dry Valleys (henceforth Dry Valleys), the largest ice-free region of the Antarctic continent

Sentence_species: AY493576.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: Oligotrophic soils from the Dry Valleys are considered to be microbiologically distinct from all other soils worldwide

Sentence_species: AY493576.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: In addition to soil environments, rocky niches are of particular relevance in the Dry Valleys ecosystems since they provide protection to different biota from harsh environmental conditions such as intense solar radiation exposure, temperature fluctuations, wind, and desiccation (Cockell and Stokes, 2004; Walker and Pace, 2007).

Sentence_species: AY493576.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: These rock-inhabiting organisms are very important in Dry Valleys because of the extent of rockexposed surface, thus accounting largely for the productivity and biomass in this system (Omelon, 2008;

Sentence_species: AY493576.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: Dry Valleys

Sentence_species: AY493576.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location:
Indeed, as primary colonizers after the retreat of glaciers, cyanobacteria are leading components of Dry Valleys ecosystem, enabling colonization by
other microorganisms (Vincent, 2000).

Sentence_species: AY493576.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: They are well adapted to the stress of desiccation and despite most of the Dry Valleys soils lack any visible cyanobacterial growth, their presence was detected through HTS even in low moisture soil samples (Wood et al., 2008).

Sentence_species: AY493576.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: Cultivation-independent studies have revealed that in the Dry Valleys, abiotic factors drive the diversity and structure of microbial communities (Pointing et al., 2009; Lee et al., 2012; Magalhaes et al., 2012).

Sentence_species: AY493576.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: Aridity seem to be the most preponderant factor shaping bacterial communites, not only in Dry Valleys but across multiple deserts (Kastovska et al., 2005; Pointing et al., 2007; Wood et al., 2008).

Sentence_species: AY493576.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: In the present study, we combine HTS and microbial cultivation techniques as culture-independent and dependent approaches to survey actinobacteria and cyanobacteria diversity along different soil and endolithic micro-environments of Victoria Valley, one of the Dry Valleys.

Sentence_species: AY493576.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: | Variation of soil characteristics across the Dry Valley soil transect, including water availability

Sentence_species: AY493576.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: The hyper-arid desert of McMurdo Dry Valleys, located in Victoria Land is considered one of the most inhospitable habitats, being restricted to microbial colonization (Pointing et al., 2009).

Sentence_species: AY493576.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: Actinobacteria, Acidobacteria, and Bacteroidetes are usually the dominant phyla described for Dry Valleys (Aislabie et al., 2006; Cary et al., 2010).

Sentence_species: AY493576.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: The Rubrobacter genus, commonly found in Dry Valleys (Wei et al., 2016) has been reported as dominant genus of endolithic microbial communities in Atacama Desert

Sentence_species: AY493576.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: The Rubrobacter genus, commonly found in Dry Valleys (Wei et al., 2016) has been reported as dominant genus of endolithic microbial communities in Atacama Desert

Sentence_species: AY493576.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: (2013) in Arctic desert soils.

Sentence_species: AY493576.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: Previous studies have detected Rubrobacter in Dry Valleys soils (Aislabie et al., 2013; Wei et al., 2016), and the observed distribution suggests that this genus might be widely adapted to this environment.

Sentence_species: AY493576.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: Members of Sporichthyaceae family, with a higher distribution in sample T5, have been reported from Dry Valleys soil (Van Goethem et al., 2016) and cryptoendolithic communities (de la Torre et al., 2003) as well as Atacama desert soils (Idris et al., 2017).

Sentence_species: AY493576.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: Members of Euzebyaceae were detected particularly in END and T3 sample (Figure 3C), which is corroborated by previous works that have found the presence of members of the Euzebya genus in Dry Valleys hypolithic and endolithic communities (Van Goethem et al., 2016).

Sentence_species: AY493576.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: In Atacama desert, their presence was also detected in endolithic microhabitats (Meslier et al., 2018).

Sentence_species: AY493576.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: According to the literature, Euzebya seems to be highly adapted to endolithic and hypolithic environments, however, our study seems to be the first that detected the presence of this genus in the Dry Valleys soils.

Sentence_species: AY493576.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location:
Remarkably, the endolithic sample was the only among those studied to harbor actinobacteria affiliated with Streptomycetaceae, a family commonly found and retrieved by
cultivation from Dry Valleys soils samples (Cameron et al., 1972; Babalola et al., 2009).

Sentence_species: AY493576.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location:
Culture-Dependent Isolation and
Diversity of Actinobacterial Strains
Culture-based studies on Dry Valleys have initially proposed a dominance of a small number of aerobic groups, and
few anaerobic isolates for endolithic

Sentence_species: AY493576.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: However, molecular-based phylogenetic studies have revealed microbial diversity of Antarctic Dry Valley as remarkably high (Smith et al., 2006).

Sentence_species: AY493576.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: At least 14 different bacterial phyla have been described from Dry Valleys bacterial lithic communities dominated by Acidobacteria, Actinobacteria and Bacteroidetes (Cary et al., 2010).

Sentence_species: AY493576.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: For the Sporichthyaceae family, there are no records of cultivation isolates in Antarctica.

Sentence_species: AY493576.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: The Kocuria genus has resulted from the phylogenetic and chemotaxonomic division of Micrococcus genus and both include species isolated in Antarctica (Liu et al., 2000; Reddy et al., 2003).

Sentence_species: AY493576.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: genus have also been previously isolated from Galindez Island, maritime Antarctica (Vasileva-Tonkova et al., 2014).

Cyanobacteria dominance and adaptive success in Antarctica is well known

Sentence_location: Pioneer studies on Dry Valleys cyanobacterial distribution, have proven that the majority of cryptoendolithic cyanobacteriadominated communities belong to the Phormidium genus (Friedmann, 1986).

Sentence_location: one Leptolyngbya antarctica strain previously isolated from a benthic microbial mat in Dry Valleys and eastern Antarctic lakes (Taton et al., 2006).

Sentence_location: Interestingly, L. antarctica ANT.LAC.1 is the only strain from Antarctica present on the clade harboring the referred isolated strains (LEGE 13457 and LEGE 13458;

Sentence_location: According to the phylogenetic tree, the unidentified Synechococcales strain is most closely related to uncultured cyanobacterium strains from Antarctica, and according to the matrix of distances it only shares 97.5% of similarity to Phormidesmis priestleyi ANT.LACV5.1, suggesting it can represent a new species.

Sentence_species: AY493576.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: Particularly, the clade of L. frigida is composed in its majority of strains isolated in Antarctica or cold-environments.

Sentence_species: AY493576.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: Notably, most of the closest relatives at NCBI correspond all to the same study (Taton et al. 2006) that assessed the cyanobacteria diversity in Antarctic lakes, including in the Dry Valleys.

Sentence_location: Although might reduce the confidence of our hypothesis, most of the results presented are supported by previous studies that should, however, be further explored in future sampling campaigns in the Dry Valleys.

Sentence_species: AY493576.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: This study combined pyrosequencing and cultivation techniques to assess the actinobacteria and cyanobacteria diversity of Dry Valleys microenvironments.

Sentence_species: AY493576.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: This study highlights the capacity of Dry Valleys prokaryotic communities to thrive below thresholds that are considered to be life-limiting.

Sentence_location:
The major role of actinobacteria and cyanobacteria, the dominant heterotrophs
and phototrophs, in Dry Valleys ecosystem is supported by their distribution across environmental gradients.

Bacterial diversity from McMurdo Dry Valleys in Antarctica, the coldest desert on earth, has become more easily assessed with the development of High Throughput Sequencing (HTS) techniques.

Sentence_species: AR3-B-1A 6E AY493612.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: In this study, we combine cultivation and HIS techniques to survey actinobacteria and cyanobacteria diversity along different soll and endolithic micro-environments of Victoria Valley in McMurdo Dry Valleys.

Sentence_species: AR3-B-1A 6E AY493612.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: Our results demonstrate that the Dry Valleys actinobacteria and cyanobacteria distribution is driven by environmental forces, in particular the effect of water availability and endolithic environments clearly conditioned the distribution of those communities.

Sentence_location: In the McMurdo Dry Valleys (henceforth Dry Valleys), the largest ice-free region of the Antarctic continent

Sentence_species: AR3-B-1A 6E AY493612.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: Oligotrophic soils from the Dry Valleys are considered to be microbiologically distinct from all other soils worldwide

Sentence_species: AR3-B-1A 6E AY493612.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: In addition to soil environments, rocky niches are of particular relevance in the Dry Valleys ecosystems since they provide protection to different biota from harsh environmental conditions such as intense solar radiation exposure, temperature fluctuations, wind, and desiccation (Cockell and Stokes, 2004; Walker and Pace, 2007).

Sentence_species: AR3-B-1A 6E AY493612.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: These rock-inhabiting organisms are very important in Dry Valleys because of the extent of rockexposed surface, thus accounting largely for the productivity and biomass in this system (Omelon, 2008;

Sentence_location: Dry Valleys

Sentence_species: AR3-B-1A 6E AY493612.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location:
Indeed, as primary colonizers after the retreat of glaciers, cyanobacteria are leading components of Dry Valleys ecosystem, enabling colonization by
other microorganisms (Vincent, 2000).

Sentence_species: AR3-B-1A 6E AY493612.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: They are well adapted to the stress of desiccation and despite most of the Dry Valleys soils lack any visible cyanobacterial growth, their presence was detected through HTS even in low moisture soil samples (Wood et al., 2008).

Sentence_species: AR3-B-1A 6E AY493612.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: Cultivation-independent studies have revealed that in the Dry Valleys, abiotic factors drive the diversity and structure of microbial communities (Pointing et al., 2009; Lee et al., 2012; Magalhaes et al., 2012).

Sentence_species: AR3-B-1A 6E AY493612.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: Aridity seem to be the most preponderant factor shaping bacterial communites, not only in Dry Valleys but across multiple deserts (Kastovska et al., 2005; Pointing et al., 2007; Wood et al., 2008).

Sentence_species: AR3-B-1A 6E AY493612.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: In the present study, we combine HTS and microbial cultivation techniques as culture-independent and dependent approaches to survey actinobacteria and cyanobacteria diversity along different soil and endolithic micro-environments of Victoria Valley, one of the Dry Valleys.

Sentence_species: AR3-B-1A 6E AY493612.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: The hyper-arid desert of McMurdo Dry Valleys, located in Victoria Land is considered one of the most inhospitable habitats, being restricted to microbial colonization (Pointing et al., 2009).

Sentence_location: Members of Sporichthyaceae family, with a higher distribution in sample T5, have been reported from Dry Valleys soil (Van Goethem et al., 2016) and cryptoendolithic communities (de la Torre et al., 2003) as well as Atacama desert soils (Idris et al., 2017).

Sentence_species: AR3-B-1A 6E AY493612.1 Leptolyngbya frigida

Sentence_species: AR3-B-1A 6E AY493612.1 Leptolyngbya frigida

Sentence_species: AR3-B-1A 6E AY493612.1 Leptolyngbya frigida
Sentence_location: According to the literature, Euzebya seems to be highly adapted to endolithic and hypolithic environments, however, our study seems to be the first that detected the presence of this genus in the Dry Valleys soils.

Remarkably, the endolithic sample was the only among those studied to harbor actinobacteria affiliated with Streptomycetaceae, a family commonly found and retrieved by
